title: griffon_mask
body:
[b]Tizoc[/b], otherwise known as [b]Griffon Mask[/b] or [b]The Griffon[/b] in the Japanese version, is a character from both the [[Fatal Fury]] and [[The King of Fighters]] series. He started out in the Fatal Fury game, [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]]. He replaced [[Raiden (snk)|]] for the [[The King of Fighters 2003]] lineup. 

Tizoc is a heroic Mexican "luchador" [i](wrestler)[/i], and hails from [[Mexico]]. Definitely [i]not[/i] [[King of Dinosaurs]].

He is voiced by Hanada Hikaru.

title: billy_kane
body:
Pronounced "Billy Kahn". One of the minor villains in the [[Fatal Fury]] and [[The King of Fighters]] series.

He wields a [[three section staff]] in which he can infuse with [[fire]].

He is [[Geese Howard]]'s right-hand man. As of [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], following the death of Geese, Billy is the new leader of his syndicate, the Howard Connection. [[Lilly Kane]] is his innocent little sister.

title: dog_nigga
body:
A webcomic created by DH Animations in collaboration with the artist [[SerbianHero]] in 2020.
Censored copies use the alternative name "[i]Dog Ningen[/i]".

It tells the story of [[Rex (Dog Nigga)|]], a half-human, half-dog who was conceived when a drunk man raped a stray female [[dog]]. After being forced to live his life as a freak rejected by society, Rex must now find his father and rape him back.

h4. External Links
* "Official Website":[https://dogniggaofficial.com/]

title: silver_the_hedgehog
body:
A [[Sonic (series)|]] character.

A psychic hedgehog from a dystopian future. Silver is a time traveler with a mission to right the wrongs of the past to ensure that his future is saved from catastrophe. Silver's ability is Psychokinesis, which allows him to manipulate objects with his mind. In [[Sonic the Hedgehog (2006)]], he and [[Blaze the Cat]] are companions, working together to find out who was the [[Iblis (sonic)|]] Trigger, the person responsible for the destruction of their time. He is also a potential expy of [[Trunks (future) (dragon ball)|Trunks]] from the [i][[Dragon Ball Z]][/i] series, being that they are both time travelers trying to save their future from certain destruction.

His voice actors are Pete Capella (2006-2010), Quinton Flynn (2010-2017) and Bryce Papenbrook (2019).

His seiyuu is [[Ono Daisuke]].

h4. See Also

* [[Super Silver]]

title: knuckles_the_echidna
body:
[[Sonic the Hedgehog]]'s friend and former rival, Knuckles is a red echidna who gets his name from the spikes on his knuckles. He possesses resilience and strength, and can glide in the air. Because he had to protect the Master Emerald alone before meeting Sonic and [[tails (sonic)|Tails]], he lacked social abilities and was gullible. He has a fierce rivalry with [[Rouge the Bat]].

His seiyuu is [[Kanna Nobutoshi]].

h4. See also

* [[Super Knuckles|Hyper Knuckles]]

title: yuki_aine
body:
One of the main characters of [[Aikatsu Friends!]] and an [[idol]]. She enrolls in [[star harmony academy school uniform|Star Harmony Academy]] at the beginning of the series. She's [[Minato Mio]]'s partner in the friend unit named Pure Palette.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[gradient hair]] consisting of the color [[pink_hair|pink]] and [[orange_hair|orange]] that ends in [[drill_hair|drills]] and goes right [[hair_over_shoulder|over her shoulders]]. She wears a [[blue bow]] in her [[hair_bow|hair]] with a [[hairband]], the latter which she ditches in the second season.

[b]Tagging note:[/b] when a post depicts Aine with [[large breasts]], please also include the [[alternate breast size]] tag, as the size is not canonically accurate. See below for more info.

In the second season of the series (subtitled [i]Kagayaki no Jewel[/i]), fans noticed an unexpected change in Aine's 3D model, which was altered to show a more developed bust. Interestingly, this change is not noticable in the 2D animated parts of the show (she still appears flat even in bikini), and no similar adjustments were made to the body types of other characters (see 3D model comparison "here":https://i.imgur.com/13rS3pk.jpeg). When fans online discovered this, it quickly became a meme, with many fan artists exaggerating Aine's bust size in their illustrations. Aine was also humorously nicknamed ぱいね, a pun combining the words おっぱい ([i]oppai[/i], meaning "breasts") and あいね (Aine).

title: mudra
body:
Mudra are symbolic or ritualistic gestures in Hinduism and Buddhism that typically involve the hands.

Japanese [[onmyouji]] are commonly portrayed using mudra when casting spells of various sorts, especially the [[kuji-in]], or nine seals, which are often accompanied by the mantra "rin pyo tou sha kai jin retsu sai zen."

h4. Types

* [[Abhaya mudra]] - ([[Open hand]])
* [[Bhumisparsha mudra]]
* [[Bodhyangi mudra]]
* [[Dhyana mudra]]
* [[Gyan mudra]] - ([[OK sign]])
* Hakini mudra - ([[Steepled fingers]])
* [[Karana mudra]]
* Kartarimukha - ([[V]] hand)
* [[Vajra mudra]]
* [[Vitarka mudra]]

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Gestures]]
* [[Kuji-in]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mudra":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mudra]

title: gyan_mudra
body:
A type of [[mudra]], which is a ritualistic hand gesture from Hinduism and Buddhism.

It takes the shape of - or similar to - an [[OK sign]], in that the index finger and thumb (of the same hand) make contact.

title: bodhyangi_mudra
body: A type of [[mudra]], which is a symbolic hand gesture in Hinduism and Buddhism. [[Clenched hands|Two fists]] are formed and placed one on top of the other; this gesture sometimes appears similar to the depiction of someone wringing liquid out of a fabric. The term Bodhyagri means 'The highest awakening'.

title: ringworld
body:
A world shaped like a ring. This usually refers to artificial megastructures in [[science fiction]] that function as [[space habitat]]s.

Popular examples include the eponymous structures of Larry Niven's [[Ringworld (niven)|]] and the [[Halo (series)|]] series.

title: space_habitat
body:
A large habitation facility in space similar to a very large [[space station]], but designed as a permanent settlement. Frequently seen in far-future [[sci-fi]] works.

Space colonies are commonly depicted in shapes such as massive cylinders or toruses (donuts).

Also known as a space habitat, space settlement, spacestead, space city, orbital habitat, orbital settlement, orbital colony, orbital stead, or orbital city.

h4. Shapes

* [[O'Neill cylinder]]
* Stanford torus

h4. See also
* [[Dyson Sphere]]
* [[Ringworld]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Space habitat":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_habitat]

title: help:artist_commentary
body:
The artist commentary fields are used to capture any additional information the artist has provided, namely the title and caption of the work.

h4. Deciding whether to add commentary

Commentaries should always be added to posts when they are available. When using the "upload bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], commentary will automatically be fetched from supported sites. For unsupported sites, it will have to be copied over manually.

h4. Adding the artist's commentary

You can add or edit information in these fields by viewing a post and then clicking the [b]Add commentary[/b] link in the sidebar. A dialog with four fields will appear. Original title and Original description should have the artist's original commentary, regardless of the language it's in. Commentary can automatically be fetched from the source link or another external link, or copied from another post altogether.

All posts with commentary should be tagged with [[commentary]] or [[commentary request]], as well as the language of the commentary, if it is not in Japanese.

If the artist has also posted any interesting tags, these can be listed at the bottom of the commentary field (e.g. post #2519177).

h4. Commentaries from multiple sources

Often, an artist will post a particular picture at [[multiple sources]], using a different commentary for each source. 

In those cases, use the [b]h4[/b] dtext tag for source headings, [b]h5[/b] for titles, and everything goes in the body.  Additionally, use textile links on the sources pointing to the original source material for the comment ([[help:dtext]]). Using the "Fetch" option in the commentary form will automatically fill this out for you.

See post #2387146 for an example of this in action.

h4. Translating the artist's commentary

Translations of the commentary can be placed in the Translated title and Translated description fields in the [b]Add artist commentary[/b] dialog.

Once all relevant parts of the commentary are translated into English, the [[commentary request]] tag should be removed and replaced with the [[commentary]] tag. If you are unsure of the translation, add the [[check commentary]] tag.

h4. Commentary formatting

See [[help:dtext]] for help with formatting commentary. Note that DText does not work in commentary titles, only the description.

See [[howto:translate]] and [[howto:romanize]] for further policies on translations.

h4. See also

* "List of commentary-related tags":[/tags?commit=Search&search[hide_empty%5d=yes&search[name_or_alias_matches%5d=*_commentary&search[order%5d=date]
* "Artist commentaries listing":[/artist_commentaries]
* "Commentary search metaoperators":/wiki_pages/help%3Acheatsheet#dtext-n2-1-8.

title: ara_ara
body:
[b]Ara Ara[/b] (あらあら), often spelled [b]Ara Ara~[/b], is a catchphrase which can be translated from Japanese as "oh dear", "my, my" or "well, well". It tends to be said by motherly or older sister-like characters.

It's often associated with [[onee-shota]] hentai genre or [[mature female|milf]]s in general, and is commonly used for memes to hint at a female character's sexual intentions towards a younger male.

h4. See also
* [[Ara Ara Chase (meme)]]

title: ijichi_nijika
body:
Character in [[Bocchi the Rock!]].

She has [[brown eyes|brown]]/[[red eyes|red]] eyes and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde  hair]] stylized in a [[side ponytail]], [[sidelocks]] & [[ahoge]] (often depicted as a [[detached ahoge]]. She usually wears the [[shimokitazawa high school uniform]] consisting of a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red bowtie]], and a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[white socks]] & [[red footwear|red]] [[sneakers]]. She [[playing instrument|plays]] on the [[drum set]] and wears a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[black shirt]] with [[suspenders|suspender]] [[brown pants]] while performing.

Has an older sister, [[Ijichi Seika]].

title: cooking
body:
The act of preparing a dish by preparing ingredients, then using different heating methods to cook food into a huge variety of different dishes and meals.

Similar to cooking is [[baking]], but many say that, "Cooking is an art, while baking is a science." Indeed, cooking is more free form and easy to play around with recipes.

h4. Types

* [[Deep frying]]
* [[Grilling]]
* [[Roasting]]

title: nefertari_vivi
body:
[[One Piece]] character. The princess of Alabasta, daughter of [[Nefertari Cobra|King Cobra]] and Nefertari Titi and honorary [[Straw Hat Pirates|Straw Hat]].

Together with [[Igaram]], she infiltrated [[Crocodile (one Piece)|Sir Crocodile's]] [[Baroque Works]], using the code name Miss Wednesday.

Occasionally seen with her pet bird and trusty steed, [[Karoo (one piece)|]].

[spoiler]Descendant of [[Nefertari D. Lily]], making her full name is Nefertari D. Vivi and along with the rest of her family are carriers of the legendary "Will of the D."[/spoiler]

title: polymerization
body: [b]Polymerization[/b] is a normal-type "spell card":https://yugioh.fandom.com/wiki/Spell_Card in the [[yu-gi-oh!|Yu-Gi-Oh!]] trading card game. This card allows its user to "Fusion Summon":https://yugioh.fandom.com/wiki/Fusion_Summon one "Fusion Monster":https://yugioh.fandom.com/wiki/Fusion_Monster from their "Extra Deck":[https://yugioh.fandom.com/wiki/Extra_Deck] by fusing monsters from their hand or their side of the field. As it is the main way to summon most of the powerful Fusion Monsters, it is a staple in the deck of many main characters, including [[Muto Yugi]] and [[Yuki Judai]].

title: morty_smith
body:
Titular character in [[Rick and Morty]].

A fourteen year old who follows his grandfather, [[Rick Sanchez]] on adventures across the multiverse. Son of [[Beth Smith]] and [[Jerry Smith]]. He Is a parody of [[Marty McFly]] from [[Back to the Future]]

There are multiple versions of this character from different universes in the series. This tag can be used when any one of them is portrayed.

Morty was originally voiced by [[justin roiland (person)|Justin Roiland]] from Season 1 to 6 but was later replaced by Harry Belden starting Season 7 due to Roiland being fired due to domestic abuses charges and his increasing unprofessional behavior at work.

title: felix_schultz_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the German destroyer [i]Felix Schultz[/i], as part of a collaboration with [i][[World of Warships]][/i]. 
Character designed by [[Ng Jie]], voiced by [[Saitou Shuka]].

She is portrayed with [[absurdly long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]] tied into [[twintails]], [[red eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. 

Her outfit consists of a [[revealing clothes|revealing]] [[black dress]] with [[Iron Cross]] straps and a [[center opening]] exposing her [[navel]], and [[high heels]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of one of her 150 mm twin gun mounts and 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] in a mechanical rigging with [[chain]]s.


h4. Skins
* !post #6489397: Default
* !post #7384012: [[felix_schultz_(sweet_sleepy_"revenge")_(azur_lane) | Sweet, Sleepy "Revenge"]]  - [[maid]]


h4. Trivia
[i]Felix Schultz[/i] is meant to be the representation of the Spähkreuzer 1938 design destroyer Leader, armed with 150 mm/60 SK C/25 on a Tbts KC 42T mount, which are [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose mounts]], with provisions for a catapult and seaplanes for recon. She is the third ship released under the sixth wave of Priority Ships.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: [i]Spähkreuzer[/i] 1938-class":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sp%C3%A4hkreuzer_1938]

title: aura_bullying_(meme)
body:
"Aura, do X."

Meme based on a scene in [[Sousou no Frieren]] where [[Aura (sousou no frieren)|]] [spoiler]was forced into beheading herself[/spoiler]. This led to endless snowclones with the command "[spoiler]to commit suicide[/spoiler]" being replaced with something else to comedic effect. 

The actual command may sometimes be implied instead of mentioned outright. Some posts may instead adhere to the original command but have it being executed in a comedic fashion, or simply have Aura being made fun of in a more open ended fashion, usually in humiliating or demeaning ways.

title: blinky_(pac-man)
body:
One of the four ghosts that chases [[Pac-Man]].

His color is red and is the most aggressive [[ghost]]. Once he is near the player he will lock on Pac and never stop chasing until he traps him.

title: clyde_(pac-man)
body:
One of the four ghosts that chases [[Pac-Man]]. His color is orange. 

While the other three ghosts are off chasing Pac-Man, Clyde will be off doing his own thing. He is typically portrayed as the least intelligent and most submissive [[ghost]].

title: pinky_(pac-man)
body: A [[Pac-man (game)|]] character. She is a pink [[ghost]] and is the only female of the four. She is the fastest and will try to run parallel to the player to suddenly trap him.

title: inky_(pac-man)
body:
One of the four ghosts that chases [[Pac-Man]]. His color is blue. 

He is often depicted as a goofy and slow-headed [[ghost]], not pursuing Pac-Man unless other ghosts are near.

body:
A pipa.jp blog where entries and comments are handwritten, ie. with a mouse (or tablet).

Art created on Tegaki is generally limited to 480x640 pixels; with comments limited to 480x160 px.

Not to be confused with [[Tegaki Draw and Tweet]], [[Tatsuya_(maboroshi)]]'s "raster graphics editor.":http://www.kannagi.net/TEGAKI/

title: oneesan_ga_shinryakuchuu!?
body: Toono Ao failed to get into college and became a ronin, studying for next years exams instead. To better study for them, Ao moved out to live on his own into an apartment near his cram school. It's not much, but it's a place to call his own. But not long after moving in, a drunken lady finds her way into his new home! It doesn't matter how hard he tries, she just continues to make herself at home and take advantage of him. This is not okay! ...Or is it? His humble castle is no longer his own. Onee-san is invading!

title: grant_(snk)
body:
Sub-boss of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]]. His most famous feature is his red horned [[mask]].

Formerly known as Abel, Grant was the brother and chief enforcer of main boss [[Kain R Heinlein|Kain R. Heinlein]] and master of the devastating occult martial art Dark Karate. After taking a bullet to protect Kain, Grant sat at death's door for years and sought a worthy battle to end his life. Grant ultimately lost his final battle - presumably to [[Terry Bogard]] - and succumbed to his wounds.

In [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], Grant is succeeded by his disciple, [[Vox Reaper]].

title: spring_onion
body:
This tag is for the naganegi, Japanese long onion, a variety of Welsh onion, sometimes called a Japanese leek in English due to their similar appearance. It is a vegetable often depicted as being shaped like a Y; a white twig with two green branches.

[[Hatsune Miku]] and [[Farfetch'd]] are known to carry this.

title: negi_suppository
body:
The insertion of a [[spring onion]] stalk into the rectum, vagina, or urethra, as if it were a [[suppository]].

This stems from a Japanese superstition that spring onion can be used to cure a cold or the flu by either tying a stalk around the patient's neck or inserting it rectally.

title: solo_focus
body:
An image containing multiple people, but focused on only a single person. The other characters are either unidentifiable or only a small part of the picture.

The secondary characters are usually anonymous people rather than named characters. Often they're [[faceless]] or mostly [[out of frame]] males, [[POV]] self-insert characters, or anonymous bystanders in the background.

If only one character is visible in the image, use [[solo]] instead.

h4. Examples

title: toddler
body:
[b]DO NOT[/b] use this tag if the toddler in question is involved in [[tag group:sex acts| any of the sexual acts]] - this is what the [[toddlercon]] tag is for.

A very young [[child]] that is older than a [[baby]], yet not quite old enough to be considered a fully grown child. This range often falls between ages 3 to 5. A common sign to tell a toddler from a baby if they started to move around on their own (e.g. to crawl or walk).

title: maid
body:
A person who wears a western (specifically Anglo-French)-style maid uniform. See [[wa maid]] for traditional Japanese maids.

In anime, maids typically wear some variation of the classic French or English maid uniform (the former is primarily decorative, with [[frills]], short [[skirt]], and bib [[apron]], while the latter is usually an ankle-length or mid-calf length dark-colored dress with a pinafore apron). The most indicative sign that a woman is a maid is a white [[maid headdress]] and some sort of white [[maid apron]].

If a character that is not usually portrayed with a maid uniform is drawn with one, also add the [[enmaided]] tag.

h4. Examples

* !post #5454405: English maid
* !post #5909501: French maid
* !post #17584: [[Victorian maid]]
* !post #6973173: [[Wa Maid]]

title: ringo_(touhou)
body:
[b]The Orange Eagle Ravi[/b]

A [[moon rabbit]] and stage 2 boss of the 15th cardinal [[Touhou]] game, [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]]. She occupies the position of information management in the "Eagle Ravi" Earth investigation corps and has the ability to become stronger by eating [[dango]].

She has a [[brown hat|brown]] [[cabbie hat]], wears a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[orange shirt]] with a pair of [[yellow shorts]] and is depicted eating dango [[crossed_legs|cross-legged]] and [[barefoot]] in her portrait and sprite. Being a [[rabbit girl|moon rabbit]], she also has [[floppy ears|floppy]] [[rabbit ears]] and a [[rabbit tail]], with [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[red eyes]].

title: marco_polo_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Italian battleship [i]Marco Polo[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration.
Character design by [[Nineo]], voiced by [[Misawa Sachika]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] framing [[red eyes]] with a [[mole under eye|mole beneath her left eye]], and is tall with [[large breasts]]. Her outfit focuses on a predominantly black-and-red color scheme, featuring a [[black hat]], [[black dress]], [[black cape]], [[black pantyhose]], [[asymmetrical gloves|differently-colored gloves]] ([[black gloves|black]] on her right, [[white gloves|white]] on her left), and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces with lances and containing a 406 mm triple mount, 152 mm triple mount, and three 90 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]]s per side, while she is perched on a third hull piece with the [[Regia Marina]]'s real-life red-white stripes. She also uses a [[scepter]] as a melee weapon.

Her personality is incredibly boastful, much like [[Littorio (azur lane)|]]. However, her emphasis is less on [[yuri|conquering herself a harem]], and more on gaining riches and spreading Sardegna's glory to the furthest corners of the world, much like her namesake did.

h4. Skins
* !post #4655121: Default
* !post #5020124: [[marco polo (the queen of hearts) (azur lane)|The Queen of Hearts]]

h4. History
Marco Polo is based on the [https://wiki.gcdn.co/images/b/be/1936_BB_design.jpg](UP41 battleship design), which was intended to be a successor to the [i]Vittorio Veneto[/i]-class battleships.

The design of the UP41 was intended to improve upon its predecessors, with reinforced armor, better torpedo protection, more auxillary and dual-purpose weapons, and armed with a 406mm main battery to better compete against its opponents in the Royal Navy and [i]Marine Nationale[/i]. In typical fashion for Sardegnan ships, her dedicated gun fires SAP rounds.
other_names: マルコ・ポーロ(アズールレーン)

title: mo_qingxian
body:
A character part of the [[vsinger (vocaloid)|Vocaloid China]] project. She's described as a fashionable high school student who is somewhat mysterious, but this is due to her poor health and having a slow reaction time towards things. She is viewed as being a traditional girl.

She is formerly known as Chou (蝶音) an original [[Vocaloid]] character illustrated by HANS. Her design was a top rank choice during the "Vocaloid China Project".

title: them's_fightin'_herds
body:
Fighting game focused on cartoon hooved animals developed by Mane6 and published by Modus Games. Released in 2020.

Originally developed as the [[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]] fan game "Fighting is Magic" before receiving a cease and desist from Hasbro due to attention drawn to the early build of the game at EVO. Creator of FiM Lauren Faust offered to create original character designs for the game, and thus it was spun into its own IP.

The game runs on the Z-Engine, the engine designed by the team behind [[Skullgirls]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Them's Fightin' Herds":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Them's_Fightin'_Herds

title: slavic_clothes
body:
Refers to typical traditional clothing from Slavic countries, or those reminiscent of such.

For Slavic clothing which isn't just traditional, or is more directly associated with only one specific people, use one of the tags below:
* [[Bulgarian clothes]]
* [[Belarusian clothes]]
* [[Croatian clothes]]
* [[Czech clothes]]
* [[Polish clothes]]
* [[Russian clothes]]
* [[Serbian clothes]]
* [[Slovak clothes]]
* [[Ukrainian clothes]]
Or create a new tag which would apply to the specific outfit's region.

title: arch_bishop_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The Third Job of the [[Priest (ragnarok online)|]]/[[High Priest (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Can use a [[holding mace|mace]], [[holding book|book]], or [[holding staff|staff]]. 


h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301320
* !post #7301341
Males wear a [[black choker]] [[cross choker|with]] the [[Cross of Prontera]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[white jacket]] over a [[blue coat]] with [[long sleeves]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]], a [[cross necklace]], [[white pants]], and [[black footwear|black]]-[[two-tone footwear]]-[[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]]. 
Females wear a [[blue dress|blue]]-[[two-tone dress|and]]-[[white dress]] with a [[cleavage]] [[cleavage cutout|cutout]] and [[juliet sleeves]], [[cross]]es on the shoulders and chest, a [[yellow sash]], [[white thighhighs|white]] [[fishnet thighhighs]] with [[frilled thighhighs|frills]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. 


h4. [[Official alternate costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306175
* !post #7306176
Males wear a similar outfit to their original costume, but a [[white capelet]], a [[gold trim|gold-trimmed]] [[black shirt]], and the coat now [[open coat|open]].
Females also wear a close outfit, but now their [[frilled dress|dress]] is [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] with [[yellow bow|yellow]] [[dress bow]]s,

title: sura_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The Third Job of the [[Monk (ragnarok online)|]]/[[Champion (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]], sometimes mistranslated as Shura. Mostly fight with their [[clenched hands|fists]] or [[prayer beads]]. 

h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301345
* !post #7301358
Males wear a [[Cross of Prontera]] [[cross necklace|necklace]], [[topless male|no shirt]] on their chest but a [[white shirt]] [[shirt around waist|around their waist]], [[gauntlets]] over [[black gloves]], [[white pants]] with a [[flame print]], a [[black belt|black]] [[championship belt]], and [[barefoot|no shoes]]. 
Females wear a similar outfit but with a [[chest sarashi]], [[black pants]], and [[foot wraps]]. 


h4. [[Official alternate costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306180
* !post #7306183
Males now wear an [[arm wrap]] instead of gauntlets and the shirt is now worn normally, but the rest is the same as the original. 
The female costume is similar too, but the [[white shirt|shirt]] is now [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] and they have [[black shorts]].

title: shadow_chaser_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The Third Job of the [[Rogue (ragnarok online)|]]/[[Stalker (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Usually have a [[holding dagger|dagger]] of some kind with an [[sheath]] but can also use [[holding bow (weapon)|bows]]. 


h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301383
* !post #7301395
Males wear a [[fur collar]] over a [[shrug (clothing)|]], a [[smiley face]] on a [[chain]], a [[brown cape|brown]] [[waist cape]], [[fur-trimmed pants|fur-trimmed]] [[brown pants]] with a [[leopard print]], [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. 
Females wear a [[cross-laced top|cross-laced]] [[brown coat]] and a [[fur-trimmed coat|fur trim]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[brown gloves|brown]] [[elbow gloves]] also with [[cross-laced gloves|cross-lacing]], a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[miniskirt]], [[lace-trimmed legwear|lace-trimmed]] [[grey thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[high heels]]. 


h4. [[Official alternate costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306189
* !post #7306191
Males wear a [[fur collar]] on a [[brown cape|brown]] [[fur cape]], a [[chain necklace]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]], a [[torn cape|torn]] [[black cape|black]] [[waist cape]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]]. 
Females wear a [[open coat|open]] [[brown coat|brown]] [[fur coat]], a [[red sports bra]], [[fur-trimmed sleeves|fur-trimmed]] [[red sleeves|red]] [[detached sleeves|sleeves]], [[fur-trimmed skirt|fur-trimmed]] [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]], a [[fishnet thighhighs]], [[spiked anklet]]s, and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

body:
The Third Job of the [[Alchemist (ragnarok online)|]]/[[Creator (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Usually are seen equipped with [[holding axe|axes]] or [[holding staff|staffs]]. Often accompanied by their homunculi: [[Eira (ragnarok online)|]], [[Bayeri (ragnarok online)|]], [[Sera (ragnarok online)|]], [[Dieter (ragnarok online)|]], [[Eleanor (ragnarok online)|]]


h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301411
* !post #7301414
Males wear a [[mouth mask]], [[living clothes|living]] [[pauldrons]], a kind of cropped [[breastplate]] showing [[midriff]], [[white gloves]] with [[vial]]s and [[syringe]]s, [[white pants]] with [[round-bottom flask]]s, and [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]]. 
Females wear a the same [[pauldrons]], [[vambraces]], a [[brown bikini]] [[bikini top only|top]] with [[teeth]], a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[miniskirt]], [[brown thighhighs]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]]. 


h4. [[Official alternate costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306203
* !post #7306205
Males and females wear nearly the same outfit of a [[white jacket|white]] [[blazer]], a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[blue shirt|blue]]/[[red shirt]], a [[two-sided cape|two-sided]] [[brown cape|brown]] and [[blue cape|blue]]/[[red cape]], a [[black necktie]], a [[black belt]], and then either [[brown pants]] with [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]] or a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[miniskirt]] with [[red thighhighs]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[high heel boots]].

title: bikini_armor
body:
[[revealing clothes|Skimpy]], [[bikini]]-style [[armor]].

Usually worn by attractive female warriors to maximize exposure of body parts such as [[cleavage]], [[midriff]], [[ass|buttocks]], hips, [[legs]], etc. The top part covering the [[breasts]] is either a bikini top or, more commonly, is usually shaped much like a bikini top but with some obvious [[metal]] reinforcement marks. The bottom may be a bikini bottom, a short [[loincloth]], a long loincloth, a [[skirt]], full [[pants]], or possibly some combination. Armored [[boots]] and [[cape]]s can be expected, along with options like [[helmet]]s, [[gauntlets]], [[elbow pads]], [[knee pads]], [[shoulder pads]], [[power suit]]s, etc. 

Naturally, and ironically, less coverage usually means less protection from attack, so one would think that bikini armor has an inherent [[magic]] to apply the inverse relationship between coverage and protection.

See also [[reverse bikini armor]] for armor that is also lacking in coverage, but in the opposite areas compared to bikini armor.

title: izote
body: Yucca gigantea is a species of flowering plant in the asparagus family, native to Mexico and Central America. Growing up to 8–12 m (26–39 ft) in height, it is an evergreen shrub which is widely cultivated as an ornamental garden or house plant, often referred to simply as yucca cane. The edible flower is the national flower of El Salvador locally called izote, and it is used extensively in Salvadoran cuisine.

title: el_salvador
body:
El Salvador, officially the Republic of El Salvador is a country in Central America. It is bordered on the northeast by Honduras, on the northwest by Guatemala, and on the south by the Pacific Ocean. El Salvador's capital and largest city is San Salvador. The country's population in 2023 was estimated to be 6.5 million.

h4.See also
* "Wikipedia: El Salvador":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Salvador]

title: chrysler
body:
An American [[car]] manufacturer. The marque itself known for producing various luxury and high-performance cars.

Chrysler is one of the three pillar brands of the Stellantis Group along with [[Fiat]] and [[Peugeot]], and is the direct parent company of [[Dodge (company)|]], [[Jeep (company)|]], and the now-defunct brand [[Plymouth (brand)|]]. The [[Dodge Viper]] was notably credited as a Chrysler when it raced in Europe.

title: finger_counting
body:
A hand gesture where a character indicates a number with their fingers raised. Some artists use this for [[countdown]]s, [[anniversary|anniversaries]], and [[milestone celebration|milestone celebrations]].

Common gestures used to indicate various numbers include:

* One: [[index finger raised]] or [[thumbs up]]
* Two: [[v]]
* Three: [[w]] or [[middle w]]
* Four: [[double v]] (with two hands)
* Five: [[open hand]] (with one hand) or [[v]] plus [[w]] (with two hands)
* Ten: [[open hands]]

h4. Example
* !post #3421963

h4. See also

* [[spoken number]]
* [[Tag Group:Gestures]]

title: shin_japan_heroes_universe
body:
A collaborative project between [[Toho (film company)|]], [[Studio khara]], [[Tsuburaya Productions]] and [[Toei Animation|Toei Company]], surrounding properties that [[Anno Hideaki (person)|]] had worked on that bear the katakana title "Shin" (シン). Revealed in 2021, and consists of:
* [[Shin Godzilla]] (2016)
* [[Evangelion: 3.0+1.0 Thrice Upon a Time]] (2021)
* [[Shin Ultraman]] (2022)
* [[Shin Kamen Rider]] (2023)

Has prompted several sub-projects involving the aforementioned properties, such as the 2023 [[Shin Universe Robo]].

title: house_centipede
body: Scutigera coleoptrata, also known as the house centipede, is a species of centipede that is typically yellowish-grey and has up to 15 pairs of long legs. Originating in the Mediterranean region, it has spread to other parts of the world, where it can live in human homes. It is an insectivore; it kills and eats other arthropods, such as insects and arachnids.

title: emma_woods
body:
[i]Her amazing gardening skills serve only her dearest scarecrow. What's wrong with decorating your dream lover when you have the money?[/i]

Emma Woods, or the Gardener, is one of the playable survivors in [[Identity V]], and the game's mascot.

Her default appearance has her with [[short_hair|short]], [[brown_hair|brown]] hair with [[short_hair_with_long_locks|long locks]] and [[green eyes]]. She wears a [[sun hat]], a [[white_shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with [[sleeves_rolled_up|rolled up sleeves]], and a [[green_apron|green]] [[apron]]; She also wears [[white gloves]] and has [[freckles]].

[spoiler]In her Diaries, it's revealed that her real name is "Lisa Beck"—Tthe daughter of [[Leo Beck]].

title: m'aiq
body:
[i]"M'aiq knows much, tells some. M'aiq knows many things others do not."[/i]

Better known as M'aiq the Liar, a recurring [[khajiit]] male character of [[The Elder Scrolls]] franchise. Initially an obscure NPC in [[the_elder_scrolls_iii:_morrowind|Morrowind]] who, true to his name, gave a litany of false advice, save for an in-game location. Since then, his role has evolved to being an in-game mouthpiece for the developers to poke fun at themselves and the fanbase.

body: The central character of the mod, "M'rissi's Tails of Troubles":[https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/9666] for [[The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim]]. A [[khajiit]] girl who possesses mostly human facial features (a khajiit breed known as "Ohmes-Raht") rather than the bestial features of current playable versions.

title: khajiit
body:
[[Cat]]-people race from [[The Elder Scrolls]] series.

Within the series' universe, Khajiit are unique in that their physiology and breed are drastically affected by the phases of the moons rather than bloodline. While the popular current depiction, known as the Cathay breed, makes them humanoid with bestial facial features, some breeds have human facial features to varying degrees, from still having bestial ears to being indistinguishable from wood elves. There are even quadrupedal breeds range from being as large as tigers or as small as house cats. There are at least 16 known breeds within the Elder Scrolls universe.

title: toritaten
body:
A "nen beast" created when [[Knuckle Bine]]'s [[Potclean]] transforms.
It looks like a purple cat with a pair or red [[wings]] and the hiragana と ("to") on its forehead.
Its ability is to latch onto its victim and force them into the "zetsu" state, preventing them from using [[nen_(hunter_x_hunter)|]].

Called I.R.S. (Individual Ren Suppressor) in the English translation.

title: nhk_ni_youkoso!
body:
"NHKにようこそ!  ([i]NHK ni youkoso![/i], Welcome to the NHK)" is a Japanese novel written by Takimoto Tatsuhiko and illustrated by [[Abe Yoshitoshi]]. It dealt with [[hikikomori]]. The manga iteration is illustrated by [[Ooiwa Kenji]].

"NHK" in the title is not "[[nhk (broadcaster)|Nippon Housou Kyoukai]]", the television broadcaster that served as the central plot point in the original novel, but "[b]N[/b]ihon [b]H[/b]ikikomori [b]K[/b]youkai" (lit. "Japanese Anti-Social Corporation"). 

It was adapted into TV anime series and a manga series. Its anime title was altered to "N・H・Kにようこそ! (Welcome to the N.H.K.)" in consideration of [[NHK (broadcaster)|]].

h4.Characters

* [[Satou Tatsuhiro]]
* [[Nakahara Misaki]]
* [[Yamazaki Kaoru]]
* [[Kashiwa Hitomi]]
* [[Midorikawa Nanako]]
* [[Jougasaki Akira]]
* [[Kobayashi Megumi]]
* [[Kobayashi Yuuichi]] / [[Kobayashi Shirou]] (Manga version)
* [[hikikomori alien]] / [i]Hikikomori Seijin[/i]

h4.See also

* [[NHK (broadcaster)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Welcome to the N.H.K.":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Welcome_to_the_N.H.K.]

title: crossed_wrists
body:
When a character's wrists cross directly over each other.

It can be seen sometimes with [[x arms]] - a Japanese gesture where a character signs 'x' with their wrists by overlapping them, and having them angled in a slanted manner to form an X.

Characters may also do it to shield themselves, as a form of self defense.

The gesture may also be found in some [[mudra]]s (gestures from Hinduism and Buddhism).

h4. See also
* [[Crossed arms]]

title: self_hug
body:
A character hugging themselves, with their hands resting somewhere on the opposite side of their body - typically the opposing [[hand_on_own_arm|arm]] or [[hand_on_own_shoulder|shoulder]], or even the [[hand on own opposite hip|opposing hip]]. It sometimes includes them [[crossed arms|crossing their arms]].

A character might do this to soothe themselves, such as when [[scared]], [[sad]] or [[embarrassed]] - or when they're [[cold]].

title: hsien-ko
body:
[b]Hsien-ko[/b] ([i]katakana[/i]: [b]レイレイ[/b], [i]hanzi[/i]: [b]泪泪[/b]) is a video game character from the fighting game series [[Darkstalkers]].

Hsien-ko was born around the 1730s with a twin named Mei-ling. During this time, ghosts and spirits of the dead arose from their resting places and attacked a rural Chinese village.

After their mother was killed by a powerful demon, she and her sister decided to use Tensei-no-Jutsu to save her, but they used a prohibited sub-division of this technique, Igyo Tenshin-no-Jutsu, and fought to release their mother's soul from the dark. This turned the twins into a [[jiangshi]] (僵屍), a type of Chinese vampire. This, however, also gave the two unusual abilities that later makes Hsien-ko capable of wielding a pair of giant [[mechanical arms]] which the two use to fight for their purposes. [[Mei-ling (darkstalkers)|]] is later transformed into an [[ofuda]] on Hsien-ko's hat.

In Japan, the character is known as [b]Lei Lei[/b].

title: marvel_vs._capcom_3
body:
[b]Marvel vs. Capcom 3: Fate of Two Worlds[/b] is a crossover fighting game by [[Capcom]].

It features Capcom's own characters and characters from American comic book company [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. It is the fifth installment of the [[Marvel vs. Capcom|Marvel vs. Capcom]] franchise, the eighth installment in the Vs. series, the first to be exclusive to consoles, and the second in the Vs. series to use three-dimensional graphics on a two-dimensional battle area. An updated version of the game, [b]Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3[/b], features twelve new characters, new stages, gameplay tweaks, and modes, and is first game in the Vs. series to release on PC.

title: little_red_riding_hood
body:
A famous fairy tale, the best known version of which was written by the [[Grimm's Fairy Tales|Brothers Grimm]], about a young girl's encounter with the [[Big Bad Wolf]]. She is named after the red hooded [[cape]] or [[cloak]] she wears.

Note that this tag is for the story. The eponymous girl herself should be tagged [[Little Red Riding Hood (Grimm)]] instead.

h4. Other tale tags

* [[Alice in Wonderland]]
* [[Cinderella]]
* [[Honest Axe]]
* [[Sleeping Beauty]]
* [[Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs]]
* [[The Little Mermaid]]
* [[The Wizard of Oz]]

h4. See also

* [[B.B. Hood]] - an assassin who was designed after Red Riding Hood.
* [i][[The Path]][/i] - a videogame designed as a modernized version of the tale.
* [[Otogi-juushi Akazukin]]
** [[Akazukin (otogi-juushi akazukin)|]]

title: mechanic_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The Third Job of the [[Blacksmith (ragnarok online)|]] / [[Whitesmith (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Usually are equipped with [[holding axe|axes]], [[holding hammer|hammers]], or [[holding wrench|wrenches]]. They can ride in a [[mecha]] too. 


h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301404
* !post #7301408
Males wear a [[shrug (clothing)|]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[red armor|red]] [[pauldrons]] and [[vambraces]], a [[chain necklace]], a [[grey jumpsuit]] [[jumpsuit around waist|around the waist]], [[black pants]], and [[armored boots]]. 
Females wear a [[black bikini]] [[bikini top only|top]] with a [[o-ring top|o-ring]], [[yellow armor|yellow]] [[vambraces]] over [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]]  [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], a [[white jumpsuit]] [[jumpsuit around waist|around the waist]], and [[armored boots|armored]] [[high heel boots]]. 


h4. [[Official alternate costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306192
* !post #7306199
Males wear a [[brown shirt]] under an [[open jumpsuit|open]] [[black jumpsuit]] with [[long sleeves]], [[black gloves]], a [[white belt]] with a [[belt pouch]], and [[armored boots]].
Females wear an [[open jumpsuit|open]] [[white jumpsuit]] with [[long sleeves]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]], [[black socks]], and [[armored boots|armored]] [[high heel boots]].

title: wanderer_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The Third Job of the [[Dancer (ragnarok online)|]]/[[Gypsy (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Only females can become Wanderers. Can be equipped with [[holding bow (weapon)|bows]], but more commonly are seen with a [[holding whip|whip]]. 

h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301305
They wear a [[mismatched bikini]] with a [[white bikini|white]] top and a [[feather trim|feather-trimmed]] [[red bikini|red]] bottom, [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[white wings]], a [[bracer]] with [[bangle]]s over it, a [[large bow|large]] [[red bow]] on their [[back bow|back]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[sandals]]. 

h4. [[Official alternate costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306172
They wear a [[red choker]] with a [[blue gemstone]], a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]] fastened with a [[red corset]], [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]] also with [[frilled sleeves|frills]], the same back [[bow]], [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[high heels]].

title: minstrel_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The Third Job of the [[Bard (ragnarok online)|]]/[[Clown (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]], localized as Maestro on the international server as Minstrel was the localized version of the Clown. Only males can become Minstrels. Can be equipped with [[holding bow (weapon)|bows]], but more commonly are seen with various [[holding instrument|instruments]] such as [[lute (instrument)|]]s or [[guitar]]s. 

h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301298
They wear a [[striped scarf|striped]] [[black scarf|black]] and [[white scarf]], a [[red scarf|red]] [[striped scarf]], a [[blue scarf|blue]] [[polka dot scarf]], an [[argyle coat|argyle]] [[red coat]], a [[black vest]] over a [[white shirt]] with [[juliet sleeves]], [[baggy pants|baggy]] [[black pants]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[boots]].

h4. [[Official alternate costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306169
They wear a [[two-sided cape|two-sided]] [[black cape|black]] and [[red cape]], a [[red coat]] with a [[gold trim]], a [[white ascot]], a [[red vest]] over a [[white shirt]], [[white gloves]], [[baggy pants|baggy]] [[black pants]], [[white socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: ranger_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The Third Job of the [[Hunter (ragnarok online)|]]/[[Sniper (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Always have a [[holding bow (weapon)|bow]] and [[arrow (projectile)|arrows]], usually in a [[quiver]]. Can be accompanied by a [[wolf]] or [[hawk]]. 

h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301293
* !post #7301296
Males wear a [[camouflage scarf|camouflage]] [[green scarf]], a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[green shirt|green]] [[crop top]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[brown gloves]], a [[brown belt]] with a [[belt pouch]], [[camouflage shorts|camouflage]] [[green shorts]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]].
Females wear a fairly similar costume, but with a [[green tube top]] with [[bra strap]]s instead of a shirt, [[green gloves]] instead of brown, and occasionally [[green thighhighs]].


h4. [[Official alternate costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306164
* !post #7306168
Males wear a [[yellow scarf]], a [[green vest]] over a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]], a [[brown belt]], [[brown pants]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]].
Females wear the same [[scarf]], [[gloves]], and [[boots]], but with a [[green corset]], [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], and a [[white skirt]].

title: nicoloso_da_recco_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Italian [i]Navigatori[/i]-class destroyer [i]Nicoloso da Recco[/i]. Character design by [[Kexue]], voiced by [[Koga Aoi]].

In Azur Lane, she has [[purple hair]] tied to a long [[braid]] with a [[yellow hairband]], evoking a similarity with [[Hiiragi Tsukasa]]. She also wears a [[black dress]] top, a [[white skirt]], and white [[thighhighs]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of two 533 mm twin [[torpedo tubes]] (historically triple mounts) and two 120 mm twin gun mounts (one hidden by her cape in the CG), one each per side.

h4. History
In real life, she was the third member of the [i]Navigatori[/i]-class but the only one to survive the war, briefly serving in the post-war Italian navy before being decommissioned in 1954 after 24 years in service.

h4. Skins
* !post #4482220: Default

title: leonidas_i
body:
A historical king of the [[greece|Greek]] city of Sparta, who was made popular by his fiery and hot-blooded portrayal in the movie [[300 (movie)|]].

In [[real life]] he was a very capable leader, a fierce warrior in combat and a truly honorable man. He is actually considered a national hero in Greece.

When the Persians asked the Greeks to put down their weapons at the start of the Battle of Thermopylae king Leonidas supposedly exclaimed: "ΜΟΛΩΝ ΛΑΒΕ" ([i]"Come and get them!"[/i]). 

h4. See also
* [[Leonidas (fate)]]
* [[Hoplite]]

title: aspis
body:
/ˈæspɨs/; Ancient Greek: ἀσπίς

A large and round bronze [[shield]] used by the ancient [[hoplite]] Greek warriors. 

Its large size was due to the fact that it was designed to protect the user from the neck to the lower leg.  It was also intended to protect both the soldier and the comrade beside him (to the left) in a [[Phalanx]] battle formation. As such, they were always used in the left hand in those occasions. 

h4. See also

* [[300 (movie)|]]
* [[Leonidas I]]
* [[Xiphos (sword)|]]

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with a [[red hair|red]] [[colored inner hair|inner layer]], [[red eyes]], [[white horns]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[black dress]], white [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[wide sleeves]], [[detached collar|detached]] [[black sailor collar]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear]].

title: bad_boys
body:
[b]Bad Boys[/b] is a Buddy Cop Action comedy movie series staring [[Will Smith]] and Martin Lawrence. The movies follow two [[Miami]] Police Detectives, Mike Lowrey(Smith) and [[marcus burnett (bad boys)|Marcus Burnett]](Lawrence), as they battle criminals involved in the illegal drug trade along with dealing their personal lives.

As of 2024, there are currently 4 Bad Boys movies and one spin-off tv series:
* Bad Boys(1995)
* Bad Boys II(2003)
* Bad Boys for Life(2020)
* Bad Boys: Ride or Die(2024)
* L.A.'s Finest(2019-2020)

title: friedrich_carl_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the German heavy cruiser [i]Friedrich Carl[/i]. Voiced by [[Yasuno Kiyono]] (from May 9, 2024). 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[curled horns]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black dress]] [[clothing cutout|open to the front]], black [[bodystocking]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of two triple gun mounts on an animalistic style.

Originally meant for release in a future Iron Blood faction event, her implementation was rushed into the [i]From Zero to Hero[/i] event (without the voices) on March 28, 2024 to replace [[Anson (Azur Lane)|]] following backlash to Anson's design.

title: asanagi_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Asanagi[/i], drawn by [[Asanagi]], her artist namesake. 

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] tied into [[twin braids]], [[animal ears]] and tail, and [[yellow eyes]]. 

Her default outfit consists of two [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]]s, a black [[leotard]] with a [[clothing cutout|center cutout]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]] open to the front, white [[wide sleeves]] with a [[ribbon trim]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists a [[katana]] to her back and two 120 mm single guns and two 61 cm [[torpedo tubes]], one on each side.

Her original [[prototype design]] (post #6670790) had a [[gold trim]] on her white kimono top, her center cutout was higher and essentially [[navel cutout|exposed]] her navel, and also wore a gold [[hair ornament]] on her left side.

title: adagumo_no_yaorochi
body:
The "Descendant of Orochi". Stage 6 boss of [[Earthen Miraculous Sword]] and later a recurring playable character.

An [[androgynous]] orochi and a fragment of [[Yamata no Orochi]]'s corpse. Yaorochi is simpleminded, violent, quick to anger and obsessed with the sword [[Tasouken]]. They're hostile towards humans and look down on them, but if they have to cooperate with them, they acquiesce. In speech, they speak with an archaic Japanese language, all the while using a belligerent and haughty tone.

Has the power to cut down clouds and, being born from Yamata no Orochi's arm, and also has natural swordsmanship skills. They're also [[Adagumo no Saragimaru]]'s older sibling, but they're too obsessed with the Tasouken sword to care about them.

They are frequently called "Orochin" by those around them, most notably by [[Katano Sukune]].

h4. Official art

* !post #1663726

h4. External links

* "Len'en Wiki: Adagumo no Yaorochi":http://lenen.shoutwiki.com/wiki/Adagumo_no_Yaorochi

title: flying_sword_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Ice blades that are a signature weapon of [[Yanqing_(honkai:_star_rail)|]]. He can summon several of them at a time.

This refers to the specific weapon(s), even if they are not currently flying (e.g. on the ground). Likewise, do not use this tag for any other sword in Yanqing's possession -- indeed, Yanqing usually wields in hand (or [[sword surfing|surfs on]]) a more metallic sword, not a Flying Sword.

title: mixed_media
body:
Artwork in which more than one medium or material has been employed, such as a combination of [[traditional media]] and digital (computer-based) media. 

Images where the use of traditional media isn't apparent to the viewer (e.g. traditional line art existed but was mostly obliterated by digital colors) count as neither traditional media nor mixed media. 

Likewise, if 3D assets are used, it must be apparent that they are 3D assets. If they are traced and colored over by hand, that is not mixed media. (e.g. post #5889413)

This tag can also be used for images with a 2D foreground drawing over a [[3D|]] or [[photo background|]].

h4. Examples
* !post #7252300: Traditional artwork with digital coloring
* !post #936053: Traditional drawing with [[masking tape (medium)|]]
* !post #6125476: [[Photo bashing]] with posterization applied, with drawn 2D characters
* !post #6094927: 2D character, 3D vehicle asset

title: conrail_corporation
body:
The Consolidated Rail Corporation, more succinctly known as Conrail, was an American railroad company formed in the mid-1970s following the bankruptcy of its predecessor, the Penn Central. Its principal task during its early years as a government-owned corporation was to repair and aid in the recovery of rail lines in the American Northeast and lower Great Lakes, neglected after their previous owners suffered decreasing revenue between stifling regulation and intensive competition from trucks and aircraft. Much of its early years would be spent shedding unprofitable branch lines and carrying out desperately-needed repairs on major rail arteries. The company would eventually turn a profit in the 1980s and be privatized shortly thereafter. Conrail as an independent entity would last until 1999, when it was split between the CSX Corporation and Norfolk Southern. The company exists to the present day, albeit as a "shared assets organization" managed jointly by CSX and NS to handle freight traffic in and around the ports in the New York City area. 

The company is remembered by American railfans for its particular origins, unique power (being the only railroad to order the EMD SD80MAC and having briefly run electrified operations in its early years), blue livery, and "can opener" logo.

h4. External Links:

Wikipedia: "Conrail":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conrail]
[Conrail Historical Society](https://www.thecrhs.org/)

title: eskimo_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] destroyer HMS [i]Eskimo[/i] (F75/G75). Character design by [[Shisantian]].

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] two-tone hair (mostly [[black hair|black]] with [[white hair|white]] [[bangs]]), and [[blue eyes]] along with [[glasses]].

Her uniform consists of a [[two-tone dress]] and a [[brown corset]] with a [[fur-trimmed capelet]] fitting of her namesake, in addition to [[red gloves]], [[pantyhose]], and red shoes. Her [[rigging]] consists of 53.3 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her right and a QF 120 mm twin gun mount Mk12 on her left, with ski gear also attached to the latter side.

h4. History
She was released as a playable character as part of the [i]Counterattack Within the Fjord[/i] mini-event, a reference to her combat tour in the battles of Narvik in 1940 where she sustained severe damage (losing her bow portion) from attacking [[Z2 Georg Thiele (Azur Lane)|]]. She was repaired and later saw service in the Mediterranean and Indian Ocean before being sold for scrap in 1949.

title: izumo_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Izumo[/i], as part of a collaboration with [[world_of_warships|World of Warships]]. Character design by [[Alisa (kuro no sakura)|]], voiced by [[Ueda Reina]]. 

She is portrayed as a [[purple_hair|purple-haired]] [[oni]] sporting a samurai-inspired outfit, brandishing a large [[katana]] as a melee weapon with another sheathed. Her personality is highly-contentious, and she is verbally abusive towards the Commander in an attempt to [[tsundere|hide her true nature]].

[i]Izumo[/i] was designed with an all-forward main battery consisting of triple 16.1" guns, similar to HMS [i]Rodney[/i] and [i]Nelson[/i]. The design was ultimately abandoned in favor of the 18.1" gun-armed design that would see two ships completed as specified and sent into frontline service. The name "Izumo" would later go on to grace a class of helicopter carrier for the modern JMSDF.

In reference to World of Warships, Izumo gains improved protection against enemy AP rounds, but in turn suffers a higher chance to catch fire, similar to her WoWS counterpart.

h4. Skins
* !post #3147114: Default
* !post #3364919: [[Izumo (izumo's thousand cherry trees) (azur lane)|Izumo's Thousand Cherry Trees]]

title: image_warping
body:
A type of image [[distortion]]. This is where a subject of the image is manipulated in size and/or shape, sometimes to an extreme degree.

This effect may be achieved using a digital tool, such as a 'warp tool' or 'swirl tool'. It may also be employed in a hand-drawn manner that mimics said tools.

For images with a warped background, see [[wavy background]].

h4. Examples
* !post #6519975
* !post #6981881
* !post #5070075

h4. See also

title: uchuu_keiji_gavan
body:
[b]Space Sheriff Gavan[/b], known also as [b]Space Cop Gabin[/b], is a Japanese [[Tokusatsu]] series produced by Toei Company. It is the first installment of the Metal Hero Series franchise and the first installment in the Space Sheriff series. It aired on TV Asahi from March 5, 1982 to February 25, 1983.

title: kamen_rider_black
body:
The protagonist of the [[Kamen Rider BLACK (series)|eighth]] [[Kamen Rider]] television series.

After suffering a body-altering surgery and barely escaping, Kotaro Minami becomes Kamen Rider Black to begin his battle against the forces of Golgom and save his adopted brother.

As his name suggests, Black is mostly black in color with yellow and red accents. Like [[Kamen Rider 1|No. 1]] and [[Kamen Rider 2|No. 2]], his design is based on a grasshopper.

He eventually got upgraded in the [[Kamen Rider BLACK RX (Series)|next series]] as [[Kamen Rider BLACK RX|BLACK RX]]

title: tabletop_rpg
body:
A form of role-playing game in which participants describe their character's actions through language. Participants decide their character's actions based on their character descriptions, and the success or failure of their actions is based on a formal system of rules and guidelines. Within the rules, participants are free to improvise, and their choices determine the direction and outcome of the game. Known in Japanese as table talk RPGs.

h4. Tagged TTRPG Systems

title: rukkhadevata_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

The former Dendro Archon, often referred to with the title "Greater Lord" in contrast to the current Dendro Archon "Lesser Lord" Kusanali, aka [[Nahida (genshin impact)|]]. Her visual design is only shown midway through Sumeru's story, and should be considered [[spoilers]] due to its context.

Do not also tag images with [[Nahida (genshin impact)|]] unless both characters are present in the image. Likewise, the presence of Rukkhadevata alone does not qualify an image for [[aged up]], though images with [[age progression]] could qualify (e.g. post #5731875, post #5712893).

Her appearance is loosely based on [[Kallen Kaslana]] from [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]][/i]. Her color scheme has a more bluish green compared to Nahida's more yellowish green, though there is considerable variation in interpretation.

title: magellanic_penguin
body:
The Magellanic penguin (Spheniscus magellanicus) is a South American penguin, breeding in coastal Patagonia, including Argentina, Chile, and the Falkland Islands. Magellanic penguins are medium-sized penguins which grow to be 61–76 cm (24–30 in) tall. 

Not to be confused with [[african penguin| african]], [[humboldt penguin| humboldt]] or [[galapagos penguin]]. Magellanic penguins have two black bands around their necks instead of one.

* !asset #22908842: Magellanic penguin (top right) and other similar penguins
* !asset #22894222

h4. External links

"Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magellanic_penguin

title: galapagos_penguin
body:
The Galápagos penguin (Spheniscus mendiculus) is a [[penguin]] endemic to the Galápagos Islands, Ecuador. It is the only penguin found north of the equator.

Not to be confused with [[african penguin| african]], [[magellanic penguin| magellanic]] or [[humboldt penguin]].

* !asset #22908842: Galapagos penguin (bottom right) and other similar penguins
* !asset #22894183

title: humboldt_penguin
body:
A type of medium-sized [[penguin]] found on the coasts of [[Chile]] and [[Peru]]. Recognizable by the white band of hair circling the face and throat.

Not to be confused with [[african penguin| african]], [[magellanic penguin| magellanic]] or [[galapagos penguin]]. Humboldt penguins have a prominent pink shade on their beaks.

* !asset #22908842: Humboldt penguin (bottom left) and other similar penguins
* !asset #22894193

h4. See also

* [[Grape-kun]]
* [[Humboldt Penguin (Kemono Friends)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Humboldt penguin":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humboldt_penguin]

title: african_penguin
body:
A species of penguin confined to southern African waters. It has distinctive pink patches of skin above the eyes and a black facial mask; the upper body is black and sharply delineated from the white underparts, which are spotted and marked with a black band. The pink face skin aids in temperature regulation.

This penguin weighs 4.9–7.7 lb and stands 24–28".

Not to be confused with [[humboldt penguin| humboldt]], [[magellanic penguin| magellanic]] or [[galapagos penguin]]. African penguins have a pink shade around their eyes.

* !asset #22908842: african penguin (top left) and other similar penguins
* !asset #22894159

title: uss_montana_(bb-67)
body:
Lead ship of the planned but never built Montana class battleship. An upgrade to the preceding Iowa-class Battleship with a speed plan of 30 knots and better armored. Wider than the maximum of the Panama Canal locks, in which larger locks were also in the plans. Both the ships and the new locks were cancelled mid war due to changing priorities in allocations of steel supplies.

In [[World of Warships]], the Montana is the top line of the U.S Battleship Tech Tree and is capable of sniping surface ships with its 406mm Triple mounts that are long range and numerous secondary gun turrets which are from the Midway-class (127mm Mk41 mounts)  capable of engaging destroyers and other cruisers. 

In [[Blue Archive]], Takanashi Hoshino helms the ship, despite being a Super Battleship type, she uses this ship for sleeping schedules.

title: lala_barina_(monster_hunter_wilds)
body:
A Temnoceran first introduced in [[Monster Hunter Wilds]].

It is a large temnoceran with a unique appearance. Its six legs are jointed and are covered in sharp-looking spikes. Its thorax and abdomen are instead coated in fluffy hairs. Its abdomen culminates in a retractable stinger, which it can use to sting enemies. The frontmost pair of legs is normally tucked within its body, but can also open up to reveal appendages that resemble clawed hands. Its head is small, with two large, orange eyes and a pair of chelicerae. Its most distinguishing feature, however, is the fact that, when enraged, part of its abdomen opens to reveal a tuft of red hairs shaped like a rose bloom. 

h4. External links

* https://monsterhunter.fandom.com/wiki/Lala_Barina

title: eldridge_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the destroyer escort USS [i]Eldridge[/i] (DE-173) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. Character designed by [[Kinjo Kuromomo]]. 

Being the destroyer escort most famous for the [i]Philadelphia Experiment[/i], she is portrayed with a clearly futuristic (and supernatural) character. Her physical attributes are [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a large [[ahoge]] and tied into [[twintails]], [[orange eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. 

Her outfit consists of a plain [[white dress]] with [[detached sleeves]], and [[white thighhighs]], while her [[rigging]] consists of multiple 40 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s and 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]]. She also uses [[Dowsing rod]]s that are normally used to detect spirits.

title: chkalov_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of a Soviet aircraft carrier design as part of a collaboration with [i][[World of Warships]][/i]. 
Character design by [[Nagu]], voiced by [[Yuzuki Ryouka]].

She bears an uncanny resemblance to [[Hiratsuka Shizuka]] ([i]even sharing the same seiyuu[/i]) due to similar attributes such as [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[lab coat]], [[pencil skirt]], [[pantyhose]], [[black shirt]], and [[high heels]]. However, Chkalov's case is due to "her real-life namesake":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Valery_Chkalov] being a test pilot, thus justifying the labcoat attire.

She differs from Shizuka in that she has [[yellow eyes]] instead of bluish-gray, has a different hairstyle, and uses animalistic ice-crusted [[rigging]] typical of the Northern Parliament/Russian faction. Her rig uses a split [[flight deck]] design with her heavy AA guns mounted on the sides.

h4. Skins
* !post #5507790: Default
* !post #5922599: [[Chkalov (seaside sunset) (azur lane)|Seaside Sunset]]
other_names: チカロフ(アズールレーン)

title: unknown_god_(genshin_impact)
body:
The Unknown God is a character from [i][[Genshin Impact]][/i] who made her first and so far only appearance at the beginning of the game.

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[yellow eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and [[pale skin]]. Her outfit is an elaborate [[white bodysuit]] plus [[brown gloves]] that meld into her skin, and she closely resembles [[Kiana Kaslana]]'s [[Kiana Kaslana (Herrscher of the Void)|Herrscher of the Void]] battlesuit from [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]][/i], even sharing the same seiyuu ([[Kugimiya Rie]]).

body:
A character in [i][[Yahari Ore no Seishun LoveCome wa Machigatteiru.]][/i] Original character design by [[Ponkan 8]], voiced by [[Yuzuki Ryouka]]. 

She has [[grey eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[bangs]]. Wears a [[white coat|white]] [[lab coat]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[blue necktie|blue]] or [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[belt]], and [[black pants]].

She is the homeroom [[teacher]] of [[Hikigaya Hachiman]] and [[Yuigahama Yui]] as well as the advisor of the Service Club with [[Yukinoshita Yukino]] as the club president. She also smokes [[cigarette]]s.

title: manchester_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the light cruiser HMS [i]Manchester[/i] (15). Character design by [[Dsmile]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with a single [[hair bun]], [[aqua eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. 

Her default outfit is the same with the rest of the [i]Town[/i]-class except [i]Southampton[/i]: a [[maid]] uniform with [[puffy short sleeves]], [[white gloves]], and [[white thighhighs]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of two of her four real-life 152 mm triple gun mounts, two 102 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]], and two 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]].

title: madsen_machine_gun
body:
The [b]Madsen[/b] [[machine gun]] is a Danish magazine-fed, recoil-operated [[light machine gun]]. It can recognized by its curved [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] that feeds from the top, the [[bipod]] on its [[barrel shroud]] and its carry handle, like the [[bren lmg|Bren]], but unlike it, the Madsen is more shorter than the Bren and lacks a pistol grip.

title: threesome
body:
A threesome is any [[tag group:sex acts|sex act]] involving exactly three participants at the same time.

A threesome is [b]not[/b] an [[orgy]]. Only tag [[orgy]] and [[threesome]] together if there is a threesome as a group within an orgy.

A threesome is [b]not[/b] a [[gangbang]]. Only tag [[gangbang]] and [[threesome]] together if there are two separated groups depreciated in the content where at least one group is a [[threesome]] and another is a [[gangbang]].

[b]Note that for tagging purposes, [[futanari]] are usually counted as "female", and [[cuntboy]] as "male".[/b]

title: boxcutter
body:
A [[knife]] with a replaceable blade used for cutting open boxes. Also known as a utility knife.

These types of knives come in two basic setups: a solid blade or a snap(off) blade. The solid blade uses a single solid blade that requires replacing when it become dull. The snap blade design uses a single long segmented blade with which you can snap off the leading end when it dulls to once again have a sharp tip. The blade can then be replaced after you run out of usable segments.

The most common style depicted on Danbooru is the snap blade design; this may be due to the fact that the snap blade design was introduced by a Japanese company in 1956. 

It is often featured with themes of [[self-harm]].

h4. See also

* [[razor blade]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Utility Knife":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Utility_knife]

title: detective
body:
An independent person who investigates crimes and looks into records. The [b]detective[/b] is either employed by the [[police]] or by a private individual. Police detectives are commonly depicted with a [[police badge]].

[[Sherlock Holmes]] is one of the most well-known detectives in fiction and thus influences the traditional detective's "outfit" consisting of a [[trench coat]], [[deerstalker]] hat, [[pants]], [[magnifying glass]], and sometimes, even a wooden smoking [[smoking pipe]].

title: gatling_gun
body:
A type of [[heavy machine gun]] with multiple rotating barrels.

The original Gatling gun was invented by Richard Jordan Gatling and first used in the [[American Civil War]] and was a direct ancestor of today's [[machine gun]]s. Though not automatic in operation, it has a hand[[crank]] for the user to [[firing|fire]] the shots and, rechamber a flesh [[ammunition]] from its [[drum magazine]], in the place of the spent cartridge, for each of its six barrels as they rotates. Gatling-style rotating barrels are still used in modern heavy machine guns such as the [[M61 Vulcan]], the [[GAU-8]], and the [[M134 Minigun]], typically to increase the sheer volume of firepower while reducing the wear of each individual barrel for continued usage.

On Danbooru, [[gatling gun]] refers to any kind of [[heavy machine gun]] with multiple rotating barrels, not just the original Civil War-era Gatling gun. If the said gatling gun were small enough to be carried by a person, then the tag [[minigun]] is applicable.

h4. See also

* [[Minigun]]
* [[M134 Minigun]]
* [[M61 Vulcan]]
* [[GAU-8]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Gatling Gun":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gatling_gun]

title: nevada_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)
body:
Official retrofit for [[Nevada (azur lane)|]] as seen in post #3170293.

Nevada in her [[retrofit (azur lane)|retrofit]] adopts a different approach to the western-style, wearing now a [[poncho]] with fringe trim and [[chaps]]. She also sports a pair of [[wrist guards]], with a red cloth tied around her right wrist. She now sports a [[corset]] and a white top with an [[underboob cutout]], and a pair of [[short shorts]] which go over her garter straps. Throughout her clothing are red and blue ropes used to fasten her clothes.

Her rigging changes slightly to twin hull design with the left hull being marked "36." The triple turrets are now placed such that they rotate in a vertical circle, while her superfiring turrets seem to angled upwards at the base. A [[aircraft catapult]] can be seen on her left twin turret.

A delicate and pretty man, but a decent man. The reason for dressing up as a woman was a prank to surprise his friends, but he was surprisingly highly rated and made others fall in love with him.
A prominent person who is not good at loneliness and always wants to be in the center of the group. He is open-minded and if pursued, he does not hide that he is a man.

body:
[i]"Ms. Van Dyne, I am not some common criminal that can be distracted by your prattling. You are nothing to Doom. And your pathetic attempts to play feeble mindgames with me amount to exactly[/i] less [i]than nothing. So please, stop embarrassing yourself."[/i]
--[b]Dr. Doom,[/b] [i]The Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes[/i]

Doctor Victor Von Doom is a [[Marvel]] comics villain, ruler of Latveria, and arch-enemy of the [[Fantastic Four]]. Originally a boy from a Romani family, he witnessed his mother's death at the hands of some demons she had summoned to fight Latverian soldiers. Swearing revenge, he began to master magic and technology. Eventually, he traveled to America to study some more, and that is where he met (and eventually became foes with) [[Reed Richards]].

Due to an incident involving constructing a portal to Hell to resurrect his mother, Doom blamed Richards for the incident for causing the scars on his face. He constructed a suit of metal armor and became the cloaked tyrant scientist known today. He considers himself to be the smartest man on Earth and shows signs of politeness to his enemies. The dictator represents the sins of pride, ambition, wrath, and envy.

Aside the Fantastic Four, Doom has faced nearly every superhero in the Marvel Universe: [[Avengers (series)|The Avengers]], [[Spider-Man]], and the [[X-Men]], to name a few.

Doom appears in various Marvel-related media, such as movies, TV shows, and video games. Among one of his most famous appearances is in the [[Marvel vs. Capcom]] series of fighting games, where he is a playable character. In Japan, his [[Fantastic Four (1967 TV series)|1967 animated version]], known as Akuma Hakase, or Dr. Demon, is fondly remembered by older fans for being a more comedic spin on the character, speaking in [[Nagoyaben]].

body:
[[Scooby-Doo]] character. Norville "Shaggy" Rogers is one of the members of Mystery Inc. and the owner, and best friend, of [[scooby-doo (character)|Scooby-Doo]]. A cowardly slacker with a big appetite, often joked to be a stoner out-of-universe. 

Since late 2017 (though jokes of a similar kind existed before), an increasing amount of [[meme]]s have appeared in regards to Shaggy that portray him to be much more mighty than originally thought of, initially starting with an association with the [[Ultra Instinct]] ability of [[Dragon Ball]] fame, before escalating to being considered a god and unknowable force of nature in similar format to [[Chuck Norris]] meme. This would ultimately culminate in his appearance in [[Multiversus]] referencing [[ultra instinct shaggy (meme)|the meme]].

title: king_penguin
body:
A type of [[penguin]] native to Antarctica. The second tallest and largest of all penguin species, second to [[emperor penguin]]. Adults are recognizable by their gray and yellowish fur around their ears and neck. [[baby penguin|Chicks]] are recognizable by their brown fur.

They can very easily be confused with [[emperor penguin]]s and gigant penguins, however, king penguins are smaller and the colors around their ears and necks are different.

title: jpeg_artifacts
body:
A kind of compression artifact.

Prevalent in images uploaded from [[Twitter]] and [[Facebook]].

These can be either blockiness or mosquito noise and are usually seen in areas with high contrast, such as near lines. If in doubt, refer to some of the images with this tag. 

This tag should be used for images where these artifacts are noticeable when viewed normally, without zooming in or enhancing the contrast.

Uploading images with visible artifacts should be avoided.
It’s not necessary to flag posts from first-party sources if the level of JPEG artifacts is still acceptable.

h6.Visualization
* !asset #22891347: An image devoid of artifacts (sourced from post #8012139)
* !asset #22891358: The same image, but with visible artifacts (sourced from post #8012103)

h4. See also

* [[tag group:image composition]]
* [[Aliasing]] 
* [[Scan artifacts]] 
* [[Lossy-lossless]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Compression artifact":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compression_artifact

title: palm-fist_greeting
body:
A traditional Chinese greeting where the [[clenched hand|fist]] of one hand is pressed against the palm of the other.

There are two types: Gongshou Li and Baoquan Li. In Gongshou Li, the fingers cup the fist, and in Baoquan Li, the fingers are held straight out.

Gongshou Li (拱手礼), also know as [i]Fist and palm salute[/i], is a formal greeting etiquette in ancient China. It is commonly used in daily occasions (meeting and parting, when offering thanks or apologies). This greeting consists of a half-fist held in the palm of the other hand at stomach level, while [[bowing]] slightly to deeply depending on how much respect they want to convey.

Note that for males, the right-hand makes the fist and the left hand is on top. For females, it's the opposite. At a funeral, the greeting is done on the other way around: right-hand on top for men and left-hand on top for women.

Baoquan Li (抱拳礼) also know as [i]Kung Fu Salute[/i], [i]Hold palm salute[/i] or [i]Hold fist salute[/i], is a common etiquette derived from (but not exclusive to) Chinese martial arts. It shows the humility and often widely used among the kung fu masters and students. This salute is generally characterized by an open left hand placed next to a closed right fist. The importance is that the fingers on the left hand should stay extended and not flexed to cover the right fist.

h4. Examples

* !post #844620: Gongshou Li
* !post #2872432: Baoquan Li

h4. See also

* [[clenched hand]]
* [[cracking knuckles]]
* [[palm-fist tap]]
* [[own hands together]]
* [[Tag Group:Gestures]]

h4. External links

* "Chinese Customs, Manners and Etiquette ":http://factsanddetails.com/china/cat4/sub19/item114.html
* "Chinese Etiquette: Fist and palm salute":[https://www.topchinatravel.com/china-guide/chinese-etiquette-fist-and-palm-salute.htm] (and the difference between Gongshou Li and Baoquan Li)
* "Origins and Meaning of the Kung Fu Salute by Shuai Zheng (2012)":https://sites.google.com/site/utsjingwu/articles/origins-and-meaning-of-the-kung-fu-salute-by-shuai-zheng-2012

title: nuclear_weapon
body:
Otherwise known as a nuclear bomb, a weapon of mass destruction that utilize either fission or fusion reaction to cause a massive, radioactive [[explosion]] (typically in the shape of a [[mushroom cloud]]) upon detonation.

This tag is for the nuclear device itself. When only a [[mushroom cloud]] is present and it is implied to be caused by nuclear weapon, use [[nuclear explosion]] instead.

Do not apply this tag to posts featuring military vehicle powered by nuclear power; this tag is explicitly for the nuclear weapons (bombs, missiles, etc.) only.
