title: chris_evans
body:
Christopher Robert Evans (born June 13, 1981) is an American actor. He gained attention for his portrayal of [[Marvel]] Comics character the [[Human Torch]] in [[Fantastic Four (2005)]] and Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer (2007). Evans made further appearances in film adaptations of comic books and graphic novels: [[teenage mutant ninja turtles|TMNT]] (2007), [[Scott Pilgrim vs the World (movie)|Scott Pilgrim vs. the World]] (2010), and [[Snowpiercer]] (2013).
Evans gained wider recognition for portraying [[Steve Rogers]] / [[Captain America]] in various [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] films, from [[Captain America: The First Avenger]] (2011) to [[Avengers: Endgame]] (2019).

title: when_you_see_it
body:
[i]"When you see it, [spoiler]you'll shit bricks."[/spoiler][/i]

A [[meme|meme format]] which refers to something in a picture which may not be seen so easily or subtly hidden. When seen, it may come as a shock to the viewer.

The Japanese equivalent on Pixiv is "おわかりいただけただろうか" or "お分かりいただけただろうか" ([i]Owakari Itadaketa darou ka[/i], 'Do you understand now?'). This phrase is from a horror TV show, ""ほんとにあった! 呪いのビデオ":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Honto_Ni_Atta!_Noroi_no_Video]" ([i]Honto ni Atta! Noroi no Video[/i], 'Cursed Videotapes Really Exist!'). When the TV staff replayed ghost videotapes sent by audiences, the phrase was used.

The exact origin of the phrase is unclear, but it likely originated from [[4chan]].

h4. External links

* "Urban Dictionary: when you see it":http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=when+you+see+it
other_names: おわかりいただけただろうか
お分かりいただけただろうか

title: puritan_collar
body:
Also called a pilgrim collar; a [[collar]] that drapes over a portion the collarbone and hangs downward. Similar to a [[capelet]], except it doesn't drape over the shoulders - it ends at the shoulder, instead.

This collar comes in different shapes; they're typically rounded, pointed or square. 

Popular in [[Lolita fashion]], and based off the historical clothing worn by Puritans and Pilgrims.

h4. See also

* [[Bib collar]]

title: mad_rat_dead
body:
Rhythm-based platforming game by [[Nippon Ichi Software]] released in 2020.

The game follows the [[Mad Rat (mad rat dead)|]], a lab rat who seeks revenge on the human doctor who experimented on him. He must fulfill this task before the end of his final day alive.

h4. Characters

* [[Mad Rat (mad rat dead)|]]
* [[Heart (mad rat dead)|]]
* [[Rat God (mad rat dead)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mad Rat Dead":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mad_Rat_Dead

title: rat_god_(mad_rat_dead)
body:
Major character in [[MAD RAT DEAD]]. A supposedly benevolent deity who grants the [[mad rat (mad rat dead)|protagonist]] the ability to relive his final day in order to die without regrets.

[spoiler]She is actually the game's primary antagonist, actually being a parasitic entity infecting the Mad Rat's brain, manipulating him so he can reach her new host by having him killed and eaten by a cat.[/spoiler]

She is an [[furry female|anthropomorphic]] mouse girl with long [[green hair]], a [[pink dress]] with [[sleeveless|no sleeves]], a [[white necktie]], and a [[top hat]]. She has [[pink eyes]] with [[white pupils]] and white [[low wings]].

h4. External links

* "Mad Rat Dead Wiki: Rat God":https://mad-rat-dead.fandom.com/wiki/Rat_God

title: warlock_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The Third Job of the [[Wizard (ragnarok online)|]]/[[High Wizard (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Can equip a [[holding staff|staff]] or a [[holding wand|wand]], but sometimes are seen with a [[holding book|book]]. 

h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301264
* !post #7301281
Males wear an [[open coat|open]] [[grey coat]] over a [[black bodysuit]] which itself is over a [[white shirt]] and [[black pants]], [[black gloves]] with [[chain]]s attached, and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. 
Females wear a similar outfit but instead of a bodysuit, they wear a [[crop top|cropped]] [[white shirt]], [[suspenders]] on their [[pants]] with a [[front slit]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[high heels]].


h4. [[Official alternate costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306155
* !post #7306157
Males wear a [[brown cape|brown]] [[two-sided cape|and]] [[red cape|red]] [[fur-trimmed cape]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[two-tone shirt|and]] [[white shirt]] with [[gold trim|gold-trimmed]] [[long sleeves|sleeves]], [[black gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[two-tone footwear|and]] [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]].
Females wear a [[black cape|black]] [[two-sided cape|and]] [[red cape|red]] [[fur-trimmed cape]], a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[two-tone dress|and]] [[white dress]] with a [[fur-trimmed dress|fur trim]], [[black gloves]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[two-tone legwear|and]] [[white thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], and [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[sandals]].

title: sorcerer_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The Third Job of the [[Sage (ragnarok online)|]]/[[Professor (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Can equip a [[holding staff|staff]] or a [[holding book|book]]. Often accompanied by their elemental spirits: [[Agni (ragnarok online)|]], [[Aqua (ragnarok online)|]], [[Ventus (ragnarok online)|]], [[Tera (ragnarok online)|]].

h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301287
* !post #7301291
Males wear a large [[fur collar]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[argyle shirt]], [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves|sleeves]] fastened with a [[bangle]], a [[white cape|white]] [[argyle cape|argyle]] [[waist cape]], [[black pants|black]] [[argyle pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].
Females wear the same collar over a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] semi-[[see-through dress|transparent]] [[argyle dress|argyle]] [[white dress]] with a [[side slit]], [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves|sleeves]] fastened with a [[bangle]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[sandals]].


h4. [[Official alternate costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306160
* !post #7306161
Males wear a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[red shirt]] with a [[gold trim]] over an absurdly long [[white coat]] with a [[pelvic curtain]], a [[fur collar]], [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[two-tone sleeves|and]] [[red sleeves]], [[black pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].
Females wear a [[long dress|long]] [[layered dress|layered]] [[red dress|red]] and [[white dress]] with a [[gold trim]] and [[juliet sleeves]], a [[fur collar]], a [[pelvic curtain]], an [[anklet]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

title: enigmatic_recollection
body:
It is a collection of stories in which the members of [[hololive English]] play a part.
Through streams, animations, and songs wrought anew, immerse yourself in fresh narratives woven from myriad realms beyond.

* !post #8039658: Poster

h1. Synopsis
Once upon a time, the girls are summoned to the mysterious Kingdom of Libestal.
Unable to remember anything from before their arrival, they become entangled in the kingdom's conflicts.
The girls are asked to defend the land from looming danger and are thusly entrusted with the kingdom's fate.

Ominous creatures----
ENigmatic stories lost within the kingdom-----
What fate awaits them at the end of it all?

title: minneapolis_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the heavy cruiser USS [i]Minneapolis[/i] (CA-36). 
Character designed by [[Mephisto (angraecum)|]], voiced by [[Shimamura Yuu]]. 

As with the other shipgirls who bear the namesake with Native American-related places, she is a [[dark-skinned female|dark-skinned]] girl with [[medium breasts]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] in a [[high ponytail]] with [[crossed bangs]] [[hair between eyes|between eyes]]. She has [[facepaint]] underneath her [[red eyes]] and [[bodypaint|on her body]]. 

Her outwear is a [[multicolored cape|multicolored]] [[red cape|red]], [[brown cape|brown]], [[blue cape|blue]], and [[white cape|white]] [[fur-trimmed cape]] with a [[brown hood]] [[hood up|up]]. The rest of her [[revealing clothes|outfit]] is a [[underboob]]-and-[[midriff]]/[[navel]]-exposing  [[breast curtain]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[brown gloves]], a [[loincloth]] with a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[showgirl skirt]] held with [[o-ring_bottom|o-rings]], [[highleg panties|highleg]] [[black panties]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[rudder footwear]] over [[ankle wrap]]s.

Her [[rigging]] is the [[huge weapon|huge]] [[cannon]] in the shape of a ship she carries. 

h4. Skins
* !post #3297429: Default
* !post #3976271: [[minneapolis_(trapper_white)_(azur_lane)|Trapper White]]
* !post #3297425: [[minneapolis_(wild_huntress_schoolgirl)_(azur_lane)|Wild Huntress Schoolgirl]]
* !post #3835354: [[minneapolis_(extreme_games)_(azur_lane)|eXtreme Games]]
* !post #4261838: [[minneapolis_(holy_night_ride)_(azur_lane)|Holy Night Ride]]

h4. [i]New Orleans[/i]-class heavy cruisers

title: kitakaze_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kitakaze[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration. 
Character design by [[Kinjo Kuromomo]], voiced by [[Tange Sakura]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[green eyes]], [[animal ears]], and a pet [[pigeon]] dressed in a [[serafuku]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[blue cape]], blue [[tube top]], white [[detached sleeves]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[brown pantyhose]], [[rudder footwear]], and a yellow [[hair ribbon]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of several [[armor]] pieces of her hull attached to the cape, 610 mm sextuple [[torpedo tubes]] to her left, and four 100 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]] with two on each side and fashioned with [[shide]]. She also uses two [[wakizashi]] on her left rig and an [[ootachi]] as her melee weapons.

h4. Skins
* !post #3480687: Default
* !post #3612518: [[kitakaze (celebration conquest!) (azur lane)|Celebration Conquest!]]
* !post #5543731: [[kitakaze (night of doves and magic) (azur lane)|Night of Doves and Magic]]

h4. Trivia and history
She represents the V7 Project, which fixes the existing [i]Akizuki[/i]-class destroyers speed, performance and Anti Submarine Warfare; retaining the same rapid firing 10cm Type 98 with upgraded Anti air including the 40mm Type 5 Bofors installed in the existing class with the addition of the real life 610 mm quad [[torpedo tubes|torpedo launchers]] with sextuple (six-tube) launchers. Such a prototype launcher was indeed meant for [i][[Shimakaze (Azur Lane)|]][/i] but weight issues prevented this, while the intended real-life improved/simplified [i]Akizuki[/i]s were cancelled in mid-1944.

title: champagne_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the French battleship [i]Champagne[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration.
Character design by [[Nineo]], voiced by [[Lynn (voice actor)|]].

She is portrayed with [[absurdly long hair|very long]] [[aqua hair]], [[flat chest]], and mostly keeps her [[blue eyes|blue]] [[closed eyes|eyes closed]]. Her default outfit consists of a long [[white cape]], [[white dress]], [[black gloves]], [[cross hair ornament]], floating [[crown]], ornate black [[thighhighs]], and [[hoof shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of [[mechanical arms]] holding her two planned 406 mm triple gun mounts with shields like other French shipgirls, two 152 mm triple secondary mounts below them, and four 100 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, all held together by her bridge superstructure to her back. She also wields a white flag with the [[Iris Libre (emblem)|]] [[two-barred cross|cross of Lorraine]] emblem on it.

In-game, she is the only battleship to have [b]medium[/b] armor modifier (instead of heavy like other BBs), but strong bonuses to AP damage, making her sort of a glass-cannon.

h4. Skins
* !post #4002144: Default
* !post #5020279: [[Champagne (lapis lazuli's first dream) (azur lane)|Lapis Lazuli's First Dream]]
* !post #6380180: [[Champagne (adulation eternal) (azur lane)| Adulation Eternal]] - Oath Skin
other_names: シャンパーニュ(アズールレーン)

title: arms_note
body:
A series by FP WORKS ([[Fukai Ryosuke]]) depicting girls with futuristic weapons and combat gear. There is a line of [[figma]]s based on the characters, and several books have been released.

h4. Characters

* [[bionic_joshikousei_(fukai_ryousuke)|Bionic Joshikousei]] (poster girl for the series)
* [[long_range_joshikousei_(fukai_ryousuke)|Long-Range Joshikousei]]
* [[exoarm_joshikousei|Exoarm Joshikousei]]
* [[tosho_iinchou_(fukai_ryousuke)|Tosho Iinchou]] (Library Committee Chairperson)

body:

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[pointy ears]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a two-tone cape with an [[aiguillette]], [[epaulettes]], and a [[popped collar]], a [[double-breasted]] [[red jacket]] that is open at her [[cleavage]], a [[black skirt]], [[pantyhose]], and [[strappy heels]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her historical 356 mm quad gun mounts emblazoned with the real life ship's badge on the turret roofs, and two 133 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]] to her right. She also wields a gold-hilted sword with a black blade.

title: monarch_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] battleship HMS [i]Monarch[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration. 
Character design by [[Liduke]], voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]].

Monarch is portrayed as a [[large_breasts|large-breasted]], [[purple_eyes|purple-eyed]] [[red_hair|redhead]] wearing a stylized Royal Navy uniform with an admiral's sleeve insignia, with a [[peaked cap]], [[thumb ring]]s, [[black gloves]], [[black jacket]] [[jacket_on_shoulders|around her shoulders]] with [[aiguillette]] and [[epaulettes]], and [[black thighhighs]]. 

Her rigging consists of her triple 381 mm guns as well as her secondary battery of four 133 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]], while she uses a [[scepter]] as her melee weapon. 

h4. Skins
* !post #3147112: Default
* !post #3171226: [[Monarch (white warrick) (azur lane)|White Warrick]]
* !post #3404327: [[Monarch (black gerard) (azur lane)|Black Gerard]]
* !post #7276905: [[Monarch (detective arriving on the scene) (azur lane)|Detective Arriving on the Scene]]

h4. Personality and history
Personality-wise, [i]Monarch[/i] is bitter over being abandoned in favor of the 14-inch design that would go on to serve the Royal Navy (though for pragmatic reasons; the Admiralty reasoned such a gun caliber change would delay completion until 1942 at the earliest), while being extremely proud of her capabilities, considering herself "The Greatest". She also expresses resentment towards her [i]King George V[/i]-class half-sisters, believing them inferior to her, especially [[Prince of Wales (Azur Lane)|]] (as PoW was the only one of the class sunk).

As a reference to being taken from [i]World of Warships[/i], Monarch gains an ability based off of the "Adrenaline Rush" skill, improving her reload as the damage she takes increases.

Historically, the only “Monarch” from the era was an [i]Iron Duke[/i]-class dreadnought. The HMS [i]Monarch[/i] seen in both games is based off of a design proposal for what would become the [i]King George V[/i]-class battleships, armed with three 381 mm triple gun mounts. British policymakers, fearing another naval arms race, called for a reduction in main battery gun caliber to 356 mm.

h4. Related characters/development
* [[King George V (Azur Lane)]]
other_names: モナーク(アズールレーン)

title: raven_(honkai_impact)
body:
A playable character in [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]][/i] since the Version 5.2, she specializes in using [[bow]]s. Voiced in Japanese by [[Kobayashi Sanae]].

Born as [b]Natasha Cioara[/b], Raven is a member of the World Serpent who is raised by the [[Gray Serpent]] to become a trained mercenary. She is the main antagonist of the Chapter XIV until XVI, where she ends up being an anti-heroic deuteragonist, temporary forming an alliance with [[Raiden Mei]]. She is also a bartender, and her "Tipsy Hour" [[official alternate costume]] reflects this.

Raven wears a black/gray bird-themed [[bodysuit]] that has long sharp red [[claws]], hence her nickname. She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

h4. Skins
* !post #6796912: Default

h4.See Also
* [[Natasha (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] - Her [[Honkai: Star Rail]] counterpart.

title: south_dakota_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s depiction of the battleship USS [i]South Dakota[/i] (BB-57). Character design by [[Kaede (yumesaki kaede)|]], voiced by [[Kurosawa Tomoyo]].

Reflecting her namesake state's history with various indigenous tribes (such as the Sioux and Lakota), South Dakota is a [[Native American]] with [[dark_skin|dark skin]], [[black_hair|black hair]] done in at least two [[braid|braids]], and [[yellow_eyes|gold-colored eyes]] (possibly a reference to the presence of gold in the Black Hills region). Her personality is dutiful and protective, vowing to keep the [[Commander (azur lane)|]] safe from any threats.

Her normal outfit consists of a black top that exposes her breasts to the point that she suffers from an [[areola_slip|partial nip slip]] in her official art. In addition, she wears black hot shorts and white [[thighhighs]] (possibly even [[thigh_boots|thighhigh boots]]), the latter of which are styled after Native patterns. She also bears a fair amount of jewelry, such as a partially leather [[necklace]] and a [[feathers|feathered]] [[hair_ornament|hair ornament]].

Her rigging consists of her 16"/45 guns as well as a portion of her 5"/38 secondary battery, and also has a [[shield]] bearing the state seal of South Dakota.

title: flandre_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the French battleship [i]Flandre[/i], as part of the [[World of Warships]] collaboration. Character designed by [[Namyo]]. 

She is [[petite]] with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] tied into [[low twintails]], [[grey eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[thick thighs]].

Her outfit consists of a [[double-breasted]] [[white leotard]], [[white coat]] with [[long sleeves]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]], and a [[hat]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of two main [[wings|winged]] pieces containing two of her 380 mm triple gun mounts plus separate 100 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]] floating above.

The historical [i]Flandre[/i] was the second ship to be revealed for the PR6 line, as one of the designs of the Alsace-class battleships in reply to the German H-Class super battleships. Unlike Alsace, Flandre has a helipad instead of a catapult used for aircraft, making her a modernized version of the Alsace-class battleships that never existed.

title: shy
body:
Having a bashful and timid personality, or behaving that way. 

A manner that shows discomfort or lack of confidence in association with others. Suggests timidity about meeting others, and awkward behavior when brought into prominence or notice

When a character acts shy, they furrow their eyebrows and have a flustered [[blush]]. Or can be seen clutching an object, especially a stuffed animal.

title: carhop
body:
[b]Carhops[/b] are waitstaff who deliver fast [[food]] to customers' cars at drive-in restaurants. Historically, they usually worked on foot, but sometimes used roller skates, and have been predominantly men or women at various points.

The popular depiction of a carhop is of a [[waitress]] in [[roller skates]] with a [[tray]] of [[burger|burgers]], [[french fries]], and [[milkshake|milkshakes]], and with other elements of 1950s American pop culture and fashion (historically accurate or not).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Carhop":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carhop]

title: l_hand
body:
A hand that forms an L shape, typically with two or [[w|three fingers]]. 

Seen in instances such as the [[loser gesture]], [[finger gun]]s and characters that are [[pointing]] or [[blowing kiss|blowing a kiss]].


Other cultural meanings:
* The number eight (North China)
* The number two (Various European countries)

h4. See also

* [[Double L]]
* [[Inward L]]
* [[V]]

title: geeta_(pokemon)
body:
A character from [[Pokemon SV]]. Known as [b]Omodaka[/b] (オモダカ) in Japan.

From the official site:

[quote]Geeta is the chairwoman of the Pokémon League, which operates Paldea’s Pokémon Gyms. Among the region’s Champions, she reigns supreme as the most skilled Trainer of all.[/quote]

The first and currently only "Top Champion" (i.e champion of champions) trainer of the entire series. Due to her wanting to make every trainer in the Paldea region stronger, she enforces a strict training discipline on all of the Elite Four and Gym Leaders under her employment, much to their chargin.

title: elbow_on_own_hip
body:
When a character's arm is drawn inward towards their body, and their elbow is braced against or around their own hip for support. 

Typically done to make a pose more dynamic. Sometimes however, awkwardly drawn limbs or angles can lead to [[bad anatomy]].

title: suruga_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the third [i]Kii[/i]-class battleship, [i]Suruga[/i], in [[Azur Lane]]. Character designed by [[fuzichoco]], voiced by [[Endou Aya]]. 

First appeared in the game's portable console spinoff game [[Azur Lane: Crosswave]] before being made playable in the original mobile version during the Swirling Cherry Blossoms event of December 2019.

She wears a white [[military uniform]], [[bike shorts]], a [[single leg pantyhose]] on her left and a [[garter straps|garter strap]] [[single thighhigh]] on her right, and a long [[white coat]] with an [[aiguillette]] and [[epaulettes]]. The coat also has the [[Sakura Empire (emblem)|Sakura Empire insignia]] on the left side. The rank insignia of her coat means "Vice Admiral" in the IJN, reflective of the real-life rank held by her designer, Yuzuru Hiraga. She is also seen with a pre-1935 IJN military sword (guntou) attached to her belt on her left.

Her rig contains five 41 cm twin mounts: two on her back, one on her left, two on her right. Like other IJN shipgirls, she also has an animalistic trait: [[horns]] with [[hair flower]]s on them.

Historically, her name was never finalized before she was cancelled in November 1923 to comply with the Washington Naval Treaty. Thus, she is also known in records as "Ship Number 11".

h4. Costumes
* !post #3639440: Default
* !post #3729046: [[suruga (hundred flower's auspice) (azur lane)|Hundred Flowers' Auspice]]
* !post #4627913: [[suruga (straightfaced model student) (azur lane)|Straightfaced Model Student]]
* !post #5000937: [[suruga (uneventful holiday greetings) (azur lane)|Uneventful Holiday Greetings]]

title: impero_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of [i]Impero[/i], an unfinished [i]Littorio[/i]-class battleship. 
Character design by [[Baizu (guszx)|]].

She has [[very long hair|]] [[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit includes a [[black dress|black]]/[[white dress|white]] [[short dress|short]] [[two-tone dress|dress]] that has a [[collared dress|collar]], shows a bit of [[cleavage]] of Impero's [[medium breasts]] and has a [[cutout above navel]]. She also wears long [[white cloak|white]] and [[green cloack]] decorated with [[aiguillette]] and lion [[badge]] with [[italian flag]]. Her feet are covered with [[white footwear|white]] [[high heel]] [[shoes]] with [[gold trim]].

In real life, she was the fourth and final [i]Littorio[/i]-class battleship but ended up unfinished due to repeated evacuations between bases and Italy's eventual armistice with the Allies. According to declassified and published Italian archival documents, she was to be converted into an aircraft carrier that would also carry V-1 missiles. Captured by the Germans, she was used as a target ship before sustaining further damage from Allied air raids. She was later towed to Venice for scrapping by the end of the 1940s.

title: shinkai_yuto
body: The younger brother of [[Shinkai Hayato]]. He is fond of cute things and dislikes being compared to his brother in regards to his physicality and racing style. They spend little time together, so it is left ambiguous as to whether or not they get along well.

title: trip_the_sungazer
body:
An antagonist and eventual playable character in [[Sonic Superstars]].

Trip is a [[sungazer lizard]] girl first encountered by [[fang_the_sniper|Fang]] on the Northstar Islands. While a bit clumsy, Trip is heavily armored and has been enlisted by Fang and [[Dr. Eggman]] to protect and guide them around the wonders of this uncharted region.

When using the [[chaos_emerald|Chaos Emeralds]], Trip can transform into a [[super_trip_the_sungazer|dragon]].
h4. External links

* "Sonic Wiki: Trip the Sungazer":[https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Trip_the_Sungazer]

title: orion_(splatoon)
body: Character from [[Splatoon (series)|]]. Called Ryan ('Raian') in Japanese. Not to be confused with the other Splatoon character [[Ryley (splatoon)|]] from the band Wet Floor, who is called Ryan in Japanese. They are a flapjack octopus. They're the composer and bassist of the band Chirpy Chirps (formerly ABXY), alongside [[Harmony (splatoon)|]], [[Sid (splatoon)|]] and [[Clash (splatoon)|]].

title: kii_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the name ship and lead ship of the [i]Kii[/i]-class battleships in [[Azur Lane]]. First appeared in the [i]Dreamwaker's Butterfly[/i] event in September 2020. Character design by [[Gujianshaonu]], voiced by Kaneko Sayaka.

She has [[absurdly long hair|really long]] [[black hair]] with [[fox ears]] on them, tied in a long [[ponytail]]. She is shown wearing a [[red kimono]] in [[hadanugi dousa]] style, with her [[sarashi]] exposed, and black [[thighhighs]] and [[rudder footwear]] complete her outfit. Plates of traditional samurai armor are also shown attached to the kimono. She also carries a large [[katana]] to her back.

Her rig is starkly different from her sister [[Suruga (Azur Lane)|]]'s, with a more mechanized appearance while keeping an identical layout of five 41 cm twin mounts. Unlike Suruga's, she has her 12 cm heavy AA guns mounted on her rig, to her left. Also of note is the [[torii]] mounted to the back.

She bears a striking similarity to [[Ushiwakamaru (Fate)|]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]], as noted when she was first revealed.

Historically ordered in 1921, the Washington Naval Treaty halted all development for the Kii-class before they were formally cancelled, Suruga and Oumi (Ship nos. 11 and 12, respectively) in 1923, followed by Kii and Owari in 1924.

title: st._louis_(azur_lane)
body:
[i]Not to be confused with [[Saint-Louis_(azur_lane)|Saint-Louis]], a personification of the French heavy cruiser featured in the same game[/i].

Personification of the United States Navy light cruiser [i]USS St. Louis (CL-49)[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Yunsang]], voiced by [[Hikasa Youko]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] tied in a [[high_ponytail|high]] [[side ponytail]] with [[sidelocks]], and reddish-[[purple eyes]]. Her outfit is similar to her (half)-sister [[honolulu_(azur_lane)|Honolulu]], wearing a [[double-breasted]] [[white_dress|white]] and [[blue_dress|blue]] [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[side-tie dress|side-tie]] [[micro dress]], [[white thighhighs]], [[high heels]], and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of all five of her real-life 15.2 cm triple mounts, two to her left and three to her right.

Historically, she and her sister [[helena_(azur_lane)|Helena]] differed from the first seven [i]Brooklyn[/i]-class light cruisers in having four 127 mm twin turreted mounts instead of eight 127 mm single open pedestal mounts and having their engines and boilers arranged alternately for increased survival. She served from Pearl Harbor to Okinawa before she was sold off to Brazil in 1951 and renamed [i]Almirante Tamandaré[/i], seeing further service until 1976.

title: jiaoqiu_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

h4. Profile
[expand]

"No matter how many times I say it, people always forget — cooking is medicine, and making medicine is cooking. Using food to treat the sick is my specialty. As the saying goes, a chef who doesn't want to be a healer isn't worth his salt... or pepper, for that matter."

A foxian healer from the Xianzhou Yaoqing and a counselor. Often greets people with a smile, but is rather cunning.
Born into a prestigious Alchemy Commission family, he once withdrew from practicing medicine due to a broken heart. However, he returned to the field to treat "the Merlin's Claw," General Feixiao.

Skilled in the study of alchemical prescription that views food as medicine, especially those that induce a sensation of spiciness. They invented a cauldron-based medicinal formula known as the "nine-squared grid."

[/expand]

body:
An [[official alternate costume]] of [[hololive]] members, first appeared on November 13, 2023 during the Hoshimatic Project training stream.

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[t-shirt]] with a black stripe across the arms and hemline with "HOLOLIVE" and the [[character name|the name of the wearer]] [[clothes writing|on it]], and a visible [[crop top overhang|overhang]] revealing a [[black sports bra]] underneath,   and either [[black pants|black]] [[yoga pants]]/[[sweatpants]] or [[black shorts]].

The outfit also has slight variations between each member, with the most notable one being [[Hoshimachi Suisei]]'s featuring a [[black leotard]] [[leotard under clothes|underneath]].

title: shimakaze_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the historic Japanese destroyer [i]Shimakaze[/i]. Character design by [[Kuroboshi Kouhaku]], voiced by [[Hayami Saori]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[rabbit ears]], [[yellow eyes|yellow]] or [[brown eyes|brown]] eyes and [[hikimayu]] (painted eyebrows). She wears a high [[black skirt]], a white top attached to it, a black [[jacket]], green-blue [[armband]], [[sleeves past wrists]], [[rudder footwear]], and a [[red bikini|red]] [[bikini over clothes]].

Her rig consists of a bow hull to her right/starboard (with an illustration of herself painted on it), with a 61 cm quintuple [[torpedo tubes|torpedo launcher]] mounted on it. To her left are two more 61 cm torpedo mounts. Her 12.7 cm twin gun mount Type D is used as a [[handgun]], and also wields a [[katana]] with the [[scabbard]] attached to the bow hull piece. 

Like [[Shimakaze (Kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]], she particularly takes pride in her speed (she attained 40.9 knots max in her sea trials), which reflects in her voice lines as well as the name of her [[playboy bunny|bunnygirl]] skin.

She first appeared in [[Azur Lane: Crosswave]] before being brought over to the mobile game.

title: le_triomphant_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the French Navy large destroyer (contre-torpilleur) [i]Le Triomphant[/i]. Character design by [[Yuugen]], voiced by [[Amamiya Sora]]. 

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[blonde hair]] tied into [[double bun]]s, [[blue eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sideless outfit|sideless]] [[white shirt]] top, [[blue skirt]], [[red cape]] with [[fleur-de-lis]] prints on the [[two-sided fabric|inner side]], [[white thighhighs|white]] [[vertical-striped thighhighs]], [[blue footwear|blue]] [[high heels]], [[gauntlets]], and a [[hair ornament]] resembling her real-life fire control director.

Her [[rigging]] consists of one 55 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] attached to her back and mounted to her right side, a hull piece with another triple torpedo mount and a 13.8 cm single gun mount as a handheld to her left, and uses a [[rapier]] as her melee weapon. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #3203084

title: phallic_symbol
body:
When an innocuous object is shaped like a [[penis]] or makes a blatant reference to the male genitalia. Common examples include [[banana|bananas]], [[mushroom|mushrooms]], [[carrot|carrots]], [[cucumber|cucumbers]], [[eggplant|eggplants]], [[makizushi]], [[popsicle|popsicles]] and [[hot dog|hot dogs]], especially since some of these items can produce [[suggestive fluid|suggestive fluids]].

For objects that resemble or gestures that reference female genitalia, see [[yonic symbol]].

h4. See also

* [[sexually suggestive]]
